about.summary: Nonparametric (and semiparametric) kernel methods that seamlessly handle a mix of continuous, unordered, and ordered factor data types. We would like to gratefully acknowledge support from the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC, <http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca>), the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC, <http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca>), and the Shared Hierarchical Academic Research Computing Network (SHARCNET, <http://www.sharcnet.ca>).

Nonparametric (and semiparametric) kernel methods that seamlessly handle a mix of continuous, unordered, and ordered factor data types. We would like to gratefully acknowledge support from the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC, <http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca>), the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC, <http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca>), and the Shared Hierarchical Academic Research Computing Network (SHARCNET, <http://www.sharcnet.ca>).

name: r-np

about.summary: Nonparametric (and semiparametric) kernel methods that seamlessly handle a mix of continuous, unordered, and ordered factor data types. We would like to gratefully acknowledge support from the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC, <http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca>), the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC, <http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca>), and the Shared Hierarchical Academic Research Computing Network (SHARCNET, <http://www.sharcnet.ca>).

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.60-17" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-np
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/np_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/np/np_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d97957cb234ec2e570fc2d02d305eadff3d71939484b3d1054ed8b67a3427f36

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-boot
    - r-cubature
    - r-quadprog
    - r-quantreg
  run:
    - r-base
    - {{ native }}gcc-libs         # [win]
    - r-boot
    - r-cubature
    - r-quadprog
    - r-quantreg

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('np')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('np')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/JeffreyRacine/R-Package-np
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: Nonparametric (and semiparametric) kernel methods that seamlessly handle a mix of continuous, unordered, and ordered factor data types. We would like to gratefully acknowledge support from the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC, <http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca>), the Social Sciences
    and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC, <http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca>), and the Shared Hierarchical Academic Research Computing Network (SHARCNET, <http://www.sharcnet.ca>).
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: np
# Version: 0.60-10
# Date: 2020-02-06
# Imports: boot, cubature, methods, quadprog, quantreg, stats
# Suggests: MASS
# Title: Nonparametric Kernel Smoothing Methods for Mixed Data Types
# Authors@R: c(person(given = "Jeffrey S.", family = "Racine", role = c("aut","cre"), email = "racinej@mcmaster.ca"), person(given = "Tristen", family = "Hayfield", role = c("aut"), email = "tristen.hayfield@gmail.com"))
# Maintainer: Jeffrey S. Racine <racinej@mcmaster.ca>
# Description: Nonparametric (and semiparametric) kernel methods that seamlessly handle a mix of continuous, unordered, and ordered factor data types. We would like to gratefully acknowledge support from the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC, <http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca>), the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC, <http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca>), and the Shared Hierarchical Academic Research Computing Network (SHARCNET, <http://www.sharcnet.ca>).
# License: GPL
# URL: https://github.com/JeffreyRacine/R-Package-np
# BugReports: https://github.com/JeffreyRacine/R-Package-np/issues
# Repository: CRAN
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Packaged: 2020-02-06 14:58:34 UTC; jracine
# Author: Jeffrey S. Racine [aut, cre], Tristen Hayfield [aut]
# Date/Publication: 2020-02-06 16:20:14 UTC

We would like to gratefully acknowledge support from the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC, <http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca>), the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC, <http://www.sshrc-crsh.gc.ca>), and the Shared Hierarchical Academic Research Computing Network (SHARCNET, <http://www.sharcnet.ca>).
